name: TheAtlantic
text: "In most cases, the blue shift is relatively inconsequential, changing final vote counts but not results. But in others, as in 2018, it can materially change the outcome," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/uDOGqoZKNT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
More than 300,000 people with disabilities are paid below the minimum wage because of a legal loophole—one that a Joe Biden presidency could end, @sarahbea89 writes.
https://t.co/3RQamKBBV5

name: TheAtlantic
text: In 28 years of teaching, Deloris Fowler has taught through a number of disappointing education reforms. But she's driven to show students the joy in reading—regardless of the curriculum, writes @natwexler: https://t.co/YKMn2MRcQK

name: TheAtlantic
text: A bulk carrier ship, loaded with about 4,000 tons of fuel oil, ran aground off the coast of Mauritius on July 25. Mauritius has declared a “state of environmental emergency,” as the growing spill threatens nearby reefs and lagoons. Via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/fxp4qHodd2 https://t.co/vDPGF7HK4i
